Description: Complete scarab, made of faience of beige colour with faint traces of a light green glaze preserved. The division between head and prothorax is only shown by its difference in shape, no lines at the back, no details shown at all. The shape of the head is oval, the clypeus only slightly indicated. The side of the scarab shows three fully carved legs on each side, on top of a base plate. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base that is not fully preserved. Inside a squatting Seth animal, facing to the right, sitting on top of a mr-sign. Above Seth three horizontal rounded rectangular signs, like nb tAwy?? The orientation of the seal is longitudinal, as is the perforation of the object.
